column1: The USA had it's first detected/reported case on January 20th and Canada on January 24th while Mexico had their first 5 weeks later on February 27th. That means that Mexico is at least 4-5 weeks later in the cycle than the US and Canada. With all the tourists from the US, Canada, Europe and China coming and going at the peak season there of January and February, the virus was probably already in Zihua and certainly other highly traveled areas of Mexico. Like it or not, Mexico is still considered a 3rd world country and lacks the sophisticated medical services of it's neighbors to the west and many of those in western Europe. This will be a big problem.Unfortunately this is not like the seasonal flu where if you get it, you get it and suck it up until it runs it's course. And the first problem controlling this virus is the detection. The first testing done in the US were with kits that were inaccurate with results taking 3 days or more. Since then the testing is done with new and improved testing kits with more and better ones coming on steam every day. There are now tests that can give accurate results in 15-45 minutes. The US has performed in excess of 1 million tests to date, more than any other country, meaning the more tests you do, the more positive cases you will find. In the US as of the last 24 hours, 164,359 cases have been detected with 3,173 deaths equaling a mortality rate of 1.7%. Unfortunately Mexico is way behind on testing. In Mexico as of the last 24 hours, 1,094 known cases with 28 deaths equaling a 2.5% mortality rate. Expect the Mexico numbers to explode if and when they ever get up to speed on testing. People are going to die one way or the other, they just won't be able to tie it to the virus without testing.I know this virus is in over 150 countries, but my concern is the USA and Mexico where I have both family and close friends in each country.

Please everyone!!! Take this seriously!! Stay healthy...stay home if possibly! Definitely “distancing “ no matter where you are! Wash your hands and wash them again and again!! So many are being selfish and still in denial...this is very real!!

I have also friends and family in many places, Lou.I can understand your concern with our country. You've been providing contradicting and even false information in the last few days about this epidemic and that doesn't take away your right to continue your campaign however, Would you be so kind as to share the sources for your numbers, that way we can make our own assumptions?Thank you kindly.
Please do not ignore this use the Internet and educate your friends. Relatives etcEurope is a catastrophe with Spain Italy daily death rate is alarming
Miquel, what number don't you believe.
"Miquel, what number don't you believe"I never said that. Please read my post again.
Ok what information do you think is incorrect?

I didn't say that either. I hate repeating myself but I'm going to reword it:It would be only fair if you shared the links and sources where you pull your numbers from so the rest us can do our own research and arrive at our own conclusions.It's not too much to ask is it?Edited: 8:39 pm, March 31, 2020
It's all there on the internet. "Help" yourself. I update you tomorrow.Edited: 8:43 pm, March 31, 2020

Ok let's take it from the bottom up:"my concern is the USA and Mexico where I have both family and close friends in each country"This is a Mexico travel forum so now we know.So can you show me on your "internet" where do you publish your predictions so your "USA family" can read it? I couldn't find it on Google.Edited: 9:01 pm, March 31, 2020

Miguiel, here you go. According to the last update on Worldmeter, Mexico has 1215 reported cases with 29 deaths related to Covid-19. But what I find interesting is when look at Chile, Ecuzdor, Panama, Peru, Argentina, Columbia and Mexico as a whole, those 8 countries to date have an average of 1500 cases with 30 deaths, But when you take into account the population difference, Mexico should be many times higher on both numbers. My guess is that both numbers are under reported.

So here we 1 week later. The number of reported cases in the US have a bit more than doubled with the death total of 10,943 being just over triple. In Mexico the reported case number has also more than doubled with the death total more than quadruple (125) of where it was just 7 days ago. Seeing as there is a lack of local news there regarding the virus, we have no idea of how ths is affecting the locals there. But speaking with family members there, things have all but come to a stand still. It's hard to picture what things will be like 6 months from now North or South of the border.Stay safe everyone. Wishing you good health.
Just know Lou that your discussion is with the known USA hater Rob Whitehead not his alias named Miguel.

We leave part of our hearts in Zijuatanejo every year We know that the staff at our regular hotel and restaurants have been laid off. I have heard of a Rotary group in Jalisco that is helping with food security in their region. Are there creditable organizations in Zihuatanejo that are helping families who are struggling to pay rent or buy food, that we could donate to?

Miguel, do you even live in Zihuatanejo/Ixtapa? (your name says Mexico City) You seem to think there are no COVID-19 outbreaks in Mexico, or maybe you just like to argue?.I agree that people posting on here should site their sources. I live in Ixtapa & I see what is going on here, Ted is right, news here is sketchy and difficult to find, the hospitals here are woefully under equipped. I went to the local supermarket (Merza) here today and there were a few ignorant people not even wearing a mask. Although the vast majority were. If you want sources follow this link.Granted that number is very low, but it is 5 more than a month or so ago.https://datos.covid-19.conacyt.mx/
as of yesterday, that # is now 6 confirmed cases & that is probably not accuratehttps://datos.covid-19.conacyt.mx/
Little Miguelito is a troll. Nothing more. Let's not feed them.

as of today there are 9 confirmed cases. The population of Zihua/Ixtapa is about 120,000. That is still low. Since April 27 that is more than a 100% increase though..https://datos.covid-19.conacyt.mx/

In Mexico, which has the lowest testing rate in all of Latin America, they are only testing those that come forward with severe symptoms, so how many cases go unknown and uncounted?I'm watching the daily numbers countrywide and unfortunately the worst is yet to. And there was talk of reopening the hotels in Ixtapa June 1st. IMO, that would be a big mistake. The only guests would be other Mexican nationals coming from virus hot spots of the country.
es verdad
"9 confirmed cases" It's Mexico, how many unconfirmed cases...............? Unbelievable data.Edited: 10:51 pm, May 21, 2020
follow the link I provided, it's from the DGE (the Official Mexican Governmental General Directorate of Epidemiology). Click on the interactive map for Guerrero, then Zihua. Believe it or not.
And they want to reopen the hotels in Ixtapa June 1st. Really? Yesterday new cases in Mexico were 2,960 with a "record" 479 deaths, I'm guessing those numbers will continue to climb.

and it's going to get worse with no clear plan by the absolutely inept presidente of Mexico. Third world nation with no direction or guidance in times like this. I feel so sorry for all the innocent victims some of whom are our friends.The only way Mexico comes out of this pandemic is when there is a vaccine. Not a minute sooner.

Gennaro, are you sure you know what you are talking about? The guru of Zihua, Zihuaknob is quoted as saying on March 12th, 2 1/2 months ago. "There you have social contagion. Here we have it contained so far and are not experiencing anything remotely resembling the hysteria prevalent in the States. Mexico took action a couple of weeks before the USA responded, but we also had protocols in place since the H1N1 hysteria." And here is a quote of his from April 9th. "I and my family are following the recommendations of our Secretaría de Salud and we remain healthy. But I am neither the president, emperor, god, tooth fairy nor anyone else's keeper. If you're referring to the second person plural, our government has excelled in slowing the virus much better than yours, so your comment is rather silly."And then this 3 weeks ago, another quote of his. "I know many of you criticized Mexico's response, but unlike the USA, Mexico had a team of epidemiólogos already in Wuhan monitoring for precisely this type of problem, as the USA would have also had if The Chump hadn't fired and disbanded its own team of epidemic response specialists. Mexico wasn't caught flat-footed but responded instantly. For all our defects our medical personnel are currently responding admirably to the challenges, and enough of our countrymen are responding well enough to slow the curve enough so that our already beleaguered medical facilities would be able to cope. We are expecting the peak of infections this week on May 6.You got that Gennaro, There is no hysteria there, because they had protocols in place early, and because they had epidemiólogos (his spelling, not mine) already in Wuhan monitoring and the Mexican government there has excelled at slowing the virus. "Medical personal are responding admirably." Sure, those that have not been harassed, attached or forced to locate to other villages for fear that they may infect others, In many cases the patient will tested and if positive, they are sent home to ride out the virus in their residence.As per his knowledgeable Quote, " We are expecting the peak of infections this week on May 6." Must be talking about May 6th of next year, because today is May 23 and the number of confirmed cases and deaths are still going up. Maybe I'm confused by the term "slowing the virus."
